overview: There will be one major project related to the individual needs of the student, covering areas of compositional philosophy and technique, including electronic and computer music, aural training and directed listening.
ilo: students will further develop their own individual working methods and habits, style, language and goals, be introduced to advanced techniques and equipment and be able to work with large scale and extended musical structures.
generic_skills: the ability to think laterally in relation to concepts and problem-solving;
the ability to communicate in an abstract medium;
the ability to take initial creative ideas through to completion, including publication, public presentation and promotion.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: A 15-minute folio, written under supervision across the semester
Presentation of a concert of the student's own works, of approximately 15 minutes
assessment.timing: Held in the last 4 weeks of semester

date_times.contact_hours: 32 hours, comprising eight 1-hour individual lessons per semester and one 2-hour seminar per week.
32 hours, comprising eight 1-hour individual lessons per semester and one 2-hour seminar per week.
